comment: No lectures, just self-taught through textbook and online videos. Confusing instructions, slow communication, and vague feedback. Major project changes were told last minute. Easy A if you follow directions, but you won't actually learn how to do research. Felt more like busywork than a real lab. Take this professor if you need to boost your GPA.

I took Dr. Salnaitis for Cognitive and Advanced PSYC Lab Fall24. Then turn around and took her for Capstone for Spring25.  She setup the course a way that it helps for students to succeed. I appreciate her help and TA especially being a non-traditional student. You will learn a lot from her class and won't feel overwhelmed. She is always available.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Ms. Salnaitis excelled at presenting complex physiological psychology concepts clearly and engagingly. Her well-organized and thorough lectures created a strong learning foundation. Her enthusiasm and ability to connect theory to practical examples were inspiring, making the course both impactful and enjoyable.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof had no in class lecturing instead it was self taught through reading the text book and online lecturing videos.This left students lost about the course material. We only did in-class non lockdown assignments, quizs, and tests vs her lecturing.Instructions for class assignments was confusing. This is a easy class just expect to learn nothing.

Awesome teacher, been in two classes and taking a third next semester. She has in class assignments everyday, but the work isnt difficult and she is very helpful and tuned in. If you submit you assignments on time you will undoubtably get an A.

A notoriously difficult class made as easy as possible. The work itself can still be challenging, but her textbook and instructions tell you exactly what to do. The paper is broken down into sections completed each week, so when you go to write you research paper, it's essentially just pulling your previous work in. TAKE HER FOR THIS CLASS!!!

An absolute breeze of a class. A (non-lockdown) quiz for each chapter, 3 (non-lockdown) exams and 1 experiment and discussion post ever other week. The experiments are easy - you just download a file, the experiment pops up on your computer and then you do a very brief (200 words) write up on it.

Dr. Salnaitis is, first and foremost, reasonable. Nothing in this class is busy work and everything that you do will be used again in the final paper. I can't recommend her enough. My biggest tip is to ASK. She is so understandable and caring. So much can happen if you are willing to reach out to her!

Overall easy class. Gave me 100% on all but one assignment. No tests or quizzes just discussion posts, two papers, and an oral presentation. Would definitely recommend taking her because she's an easy grader as long as you do the work and follow the rubrics. The only downside is she takes forever to grade assignments (like half the semester).

This class was made up of a ton of discussion posts and several long written assignments. All grading criteria is super clear and she gives great feedback. You would struggle to not pass this class if you made sure you were submitting every assignment. It was definitely time consuming but a not super difficult A. Good professor!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Don't get me wrong, this glass has A LOT of steps when it comes to doing her online class. The discussions are quite in depth but she is very forgiving. She will always work with you when having difficulty, she will allow you to turn something in if you missed it, she will show you how to do things! She is the professor to have for an advanced lab!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I have really enjoyed this course. I was nervous because of the weight that PSYC 4100 carries, but Dr. Salnaitis made this course a breeze. She has clear grading criteria and is available for any questions. 10/10 would take again!

Class was easyyy. Take her quickly before she fills. She is very sweet and pure. She will explain things very easily and is there for any questions you have. She would make us laugh and tell us jokes. The content was a medium level but she explained it super easy. Discussion boards were interactive and enjoyable. Exams were easy
This class was a breeze and I had tried taking it in the past and was nervous to try again but Dr. Salnaitis made it easy to succeed. And she seems to be pretty laid back.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Overall, very easy class. Quzzies and exams were pretty clear and made sense if you did the reading. The discussions were more interactive since each one was based on an experimental cognitive task mentioned in the textbook. Seems like she really cares about her students. Would take again. In fact, I did because I took her for PSYC 4100.

Honestly, she made this class so easy. All of the discussion posts are designed so that you can literally copy and paste them into your paper. The paper seemed so intimidating at first, but if you put forth effort for the discussions, the paper will be extremely easy. Kinda bad at responding to emails tho.

A notoriously difficult class and she has set it up so well! You have a major paper due at the end of the semester, but it's broken up into weekly discussion posts and two drafts, so by the time the paper is due, you're just putting everything together and formatting the paper. 

Feedback can be slow at times, but would take her again if I could!
